comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
New York state senator A. J. Palmer, of Ulster, N. Y. (incorrectly identified in Bain's photo), was a member of Theodore Roosevelt's Progressive Party, and a sponsor of reform legislation. In April, 1913, he introduced a bill in the N. Y. legislature to repeal public utility franchises of all types after a term of twenty-five years. In March, 1914, he was quoted in a New York Times story on the necessity of paying legislators an adequate wage, as a means of removing money from politics. Here is another Bain/LOC portrait of Senator Palmer, that was posted more recently: 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4037481316/sizes/o/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: Correction, this man's name is A. J. Palmer, not Ab.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: Thanks, Wystan.  We'll look into it and make the necessary changes.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: He is both, he is Abraham J. Palmer. I added him to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abraham_J._Palmer

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Isn't Ab a nickname for "Abner," while the shortened form of Abraham is "Abe"?
